article.author: President Bartlet
article.title: The Republican Party is dead
article.text:
owedtojoy said:
Certainly, "The Party of Lincoln" is dead, but that died when Barry Goldwater and then Ronald Reagan became Presidential candidates. The last vestige of "Liberal Republicanism" was driven out of the party. What died is the Party of Reagan-Bush, even the embers of any wish to have a broadly-based diverse party representing all Americans of all creeds or colours, is officially extinguished. For a while, we have the Party of Trump, but I tend to doubt if that will last. Marjorie Taylor Greene is now Big Box Office for Republicans, and shw could well run in 2024. Not to mention Tucker Carlson from the Right Wing TV Star Industrial Complex (from which Trump himself emerged), Ted Cruz, or Josh Hawley. Only Nikki Haley might rescue the party from complete inanity, if not insanity. The point is, with the command of key states in the electoral college, a Republican crazy could still win in 2024.
Click to expand...
A reminder that but for the "patriotism" stirred by 9/11 and a phoney concocted war, the GOP would not have won a single election popular vote in 33 years The tide is definitely going out on them but a post-Covid world recession and the ludicrous Electoral College would give them a decent stab, even as you say with a total fruit cake candidate.
